articles.content:
Prison term demanded for chairman of Hanchongryon
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The prosecution authorities of South Korea at a trial of Kim Hyong Ju, chairman of the South Korean Federation of University Student Councils (Hanchongryon), on October 21 demanded 5 years in prison, 5 years of disqualification and a fine of 2 million won for violating the election law, according to a news report.
 At the trial lawyer Sim Jae Hwan said the three charters for national reunification of the north stipulate that the north and south of Korea shall achieve reunification independently and peacefully while recognizing each other. He declared it is anachronistic and baseless for the prosecution to list the north as an anti-state organization and suppress Hanchongryon under the pretext of saying something similar to what the north asserts.    
 Kim Hyong Ju in his statement proved the justice of Hanchongryon's activities and the injustice of the authorities' labeling it as an enemy-benefiting organization.

articles.content:
Congratulations to governor general of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Frederick Valantin on his assumption of office as governor general of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines.
 Expressing confidence that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the future, too, Kim wished him success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
articles.content:
Greetings to Austrian Federal President
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Saturday sent a message of greetings to Thomas Klestil, Federal President of Austria, on the occasion of the 47th anniversary of its National Day.
 The message expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in mutual interests and sincerely wished him greater success in his work for happiness and prosperity of the Austrian people.

articles.title: Greetings to Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Ralph Gonsalves, Prime Minister of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, on the occasion of the 23rd anniversary of its independence.
 The message sincerely wished the prime minister and people of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines greater success in their work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK economic study group leaves
articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, Premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Patrick Manning upon his reassumption of office as Prime Minister of Trinidad and Tobago.
 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would develop on good terms in the interests of the two peoples in the future, too, the message wished him great success in his responsible work.

articles.title: DPRK government delegation leaves
articles.content:
DPRK economic study group leaves
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK economic study group led by Pak Nam Gi, chairman of the State Planning Commission, left here today to visit South Korea.
 It was seen off at the airport by Kim Yong Sun, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Jo Chang Dok, vice-Premier of the Cabinet, An Kyong Ho, director of the secretariat of the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of the Fatherland, Pak Chang Ryon, first vice-chairman of the State Planning Commission who is also north side's chairman of the committee for the promotion of north-south economic cooperation, Jong Un Op, chairman of the national economic cooperation federation, and other officials concerned.

DPRK government delegation leaves 
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government delegation led by Jong Thae Hwa, roving ambassador of the Foreign Ministry, left here today to participate in the DPRK-Japan normalization talks slated to be held in Kuala Lumpur.

Greetings to Foreign Minister of Trinidad and Tobago
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to Knowlson gift upon his reappointment as Foreign Minister of Trinidad and Tobago.
 In the belief that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop on good terms, the message wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Vietnamese army delegation concludes visit to DPRK
Kim Jong Il sends songi mushroom to Kim Dae Jung and public figures of S. Korea
articles.content:
Vietnamese army delegation concludes visit to DPRK
    Pyongyang, October 26 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the General Political Department of the Vietnam People's Army led by Le Van Dung, Secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam and director of the General Political Department of the VPA, left here for home today after winding up its five-day visit to the DPRK.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by general Pak Jae Gyong, generals and officers of the Korean People's Army and Vietnam Ambassador to the DPRK Do Thi Hoa and military attache Nguyen Van Chau.    
 During its stay, the delegation visited Mangyongdae, the birth place of President Kim Il Sung, and looked round Kim Il Sung Political University, the International Friendship Exhibition, Panmunjom and units of the KPA.
